department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
description: The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement
full_summary:
# RADOME for the Challenger Aircraft

## Tender Information

### Tender Details
* Reference Number: PW-CAG-017-29000
* Solicitation Number: T8493-220067/A
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-03-23T14:00:00

### Trade Agreements
This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)

### Tender Description
This is a request for proposals (RFP) to acquire a RADOME for a Challenger Aircraft under the Supply Arrangement (SA) T8493-140035 Series. The RADOME is required for Transport Canada's (TC) Air Services Directorate.

The RFP is only open to qualified suppliers who are holders of the Supply Arrangement.

### Response Instructions
Suppliers who wish to respond to this RFP must submit their proposal to the Contracting Authority listed below:

Valerie Bourassa, Supply Officer
Acquisitions Branch, 
Land and Aerospace Equipment Procurement and Support Sector (LAEPSS)
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) / Government of Canada
11 Laurier Street - PDP III, Gatineau, Quebec  K1A 0S5
Email: valerie.bourassa@tpsgc.gc.ca
Phone: (873) 455-0980

Please note that the RFP documents will be sent directly to the qualified suppliers by the Contracting Authority. It is not the responsibility of the Government Electronic Tendering System (GETS) to distribute the RFP documents.

### Opportunity for Qualification
A notice will be posted on the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at least once a year to allow more suppliers to become qualified for the Supply Arrangement. Suppliers who wish to become qualified must submit their request to the Supply Arrangement Authority:

Oliver Morones, Supply Specialist
Acquisitions Branch, 
Land and Aerospace Equipment Procurement and Support Sector (LAEPSS)
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) /
